page.title: 03ST. DUNSTANS CHURCH
page.content: St. Dunstans Church was the first symbol of Feltham and it was an Anglo-Saxon Church. It was built over 900 years ago and was built before the Normans invaded in 1066.St. Dunstans was probably named after Dunstan,the Bishop of London but before that it was dedicated to St. Dunstan. The old St. Dunstans Church consisted of a tower,nave and chancel and in had an isle. The tower which had a wooden spire was almost completely covered in ivy. The demolition of the old church was completed in 1801 and all that was left was the south side wall foundations which were used to help build the new church.A lot of the old material was used again in the new church and an original chest of drawers can still be seen.
